summary: In 2004, Republican President George W. Bush beat Democratic challenger John Kerry. Bush and his vice president, Dick Cheney, won a second term. The election focused on foreign policy, especially the Iraq War. Bush won by a close margin, taking key swing states like Ohio. He got 50.7% of the popular vote and 35 more electoral votes than Kerry. This was the last time a Republican won the popular vote for president.
title: 2004 United States presidential election
